meanings.definition: To repair or renovate something, especially a ship or building, so that it is in good condition again.
meanings.sent1: The workers will refit the old ship to make it seaworthy again.
meanings.sent2: After the storm, the crew had to refit the damaged sails on the ship.
meanings.sent3: It took a team of skilled workers to refit the historic building with modern amenities.
meanings.sent4: The old car was refitted with a new engine, making it run like new.
meanings.sent5: The tailor had to refit the dress to fit the customer perfectly.

meanings.definition: To provide a ship or building with new equipment or furnishings.
meanings.sent1: The company decided to refit the office with ergonomic furniture for the employees.
meanings.sent2: The navy plans to refit the warship with advanced radar systems.
meanings.sent3: The hotel manager had to refit the rooms with luxurious amenities to attract more guests.
meanings.sent4: The kitchen was refitted with state-of-the-art appliances, making cooking a breeze.
meanings.sent5: The school cafeteria was refitted with new tables and chairs for the students to enjoy their meals.
